title: The Unclaimed Rooms
premise: A prodigal daughter returns to her rapidly gentrifying hometown only to discover her childhood home has been meticulously preserved as a short-term rental 'experience' by a tech startup. To reclaim her family's legacy, she must become a paying guest in her own past, navigating a curated version of her memories while the real community outside dissolves.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a disillusioned urban planner in her late thirties.
conflict: Elara's internal struggle to reconcile her authentic, messy memories with the sanitized, marketable version of her home clashes with the external battle against a company that commodifies nostalgia and erases real history for profit.
setting: Present-day in the fictional town of Millhaven, a once-industrial river city in the American Midwest now being rebranded as a 'heritage destination.'
tone: Lyrical melancholy with sharp, satirical edges; a sense of haunting displacement and quiet rage.
